intro: Aylostera nazarenoensis, commonly known as the Nazareno's aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to violet. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
